data.text: @MX13826398 @NSWHealth The testing is not random, these are pcr confirmed cases, meaning there is selection bias towards people who experience symptoms. If this was % hospitalisations and deaths of randomly selected and tested people, you would see the effectiveness of the vaccine.
@GourlaySyd @NSWHealth Yes, the overall trend is downwards. Cases are trending similarly.

@apple_wonton @NSWHealth Perhaps many realise it isn't required. 
It does not stop infection 
It does not stop the spread. 
In fact, it does not do much at all.

@NSWHealth Most people need to realise. In NSW from January 2020 to June 15 2021 we only had around 158 in ICU and only 54 deaths. Basically 1 1/2 years without vaccine ( vaccine only really started properly well into  April). Originally wuhan strain the most deadly.
@NSWHealth Case numbers will increase again soon because that's what happened in Dec and Jan after Dominic removed masks. Luckily this time many people are still wearing them.
